title: Periodic waves - instrument v f inside and outside

content.question:
A musical instrument is made from a pipe that is open at both ends. A soundwave in air produced by the instrument in a classroom has speed <math alttext="v sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, frequency <math alttext="f sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, and wavelength <math alttext="lambda sub zero" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>. The instrument is then moved outside where the temperature of the air is greater. When outside, the instrument produces a soundwave in the air that has speed <math alttext="v sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, frequency <math alttext="f sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, and the same wavelength <math alttext="lambda sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>. Which of the following correctly compares the speeds and frequencies of the sounds produced by the instrument?
SpeedFrequencyA<math alttext="v sub 1 equals v sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math><math alttext="f sub 1 equals f sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>B<math alttext="v sub 1 equals v sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math><math alttext="f sub 1 is less than f sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>C<math alttext="v sub 1 is less than v sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math><math alttext="f sub 1 equals f sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>D<math alttext="v sub 1 is less than v sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math><math alttext="f sub 1 is less than, f sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
